body:
Please can I come back?

I thought that you'd unbanned me since I hadn't received a message. Then I tried connecting to the server and I saw that I was still banned from 2013. It just left me in tears. Pleas guys I wanna come back. :(

I miss everything on this server. I have no friends on this website. I didn't get time to make any.
body_tagged:
Please can I come back?

I thought that you'd unbanned me since I hadn't received a message. Then I tried connecting to the server and I saw that I was still banned from 2013. It just left me in tears. Pleas guys I wanna come back. :(

I miss everything on this server. I have no friends on this website. I didn't get time to make any.
title: Still Banned. Left me in Tears

replies.body: If you are in tears over being banned from a minecraft server then you possibly need to go outside more.

replies.body: Email support@avicus.net to appeal.
replies.body_tagged: Email support@avicus.net to appeal.

replies.body: I have already sent multiple appeals, in-depth one including my email being hacked and for me changing it. I still haven't had a single reply with 3-4 days.
replies.body_tagged: I have already sent multiple appeals, in-depth one including my email being hacked and for me changing it. I still haven't had a single reply with 3-4 days.

replies.body:
I've been gone for 6 months it's not like an average person can wait to go back on a good server for 6 months, if so please try and prove me wrong. I know I did a stupid thing and I really wish to come back.

EDIT: I was banned for using Anti-Knockback as that was the one I was only using in game. It may say that but I hope you know the quote "You can't judge a book by it's cover". I was there, you weren't. I was in Game with the Director/Moderator "Howsie22".

Most of the events are between me and him personally, however he hasn't been on for around 2 weeks.

In my books, you seem like a cool guy, you maid me feel welcome again :3
Look, I know what it feels like to be pulled away from Avicus
While my laptop was dead, my friends mocked me of how I couldn't get on
Avicus, and laughed at how my laptop was dead..
Everyone deserves a second chance
Just cuz an infraction page says what they've done, doesn't mean it was justified.

replies.body: I almost shed a tear today because I was so upset at how my friends mocked me, I bottle my emotions, because I used to be VERY sensitive, I am not like that anymore, I have not cried for over two tears now...

replies.body: You have made several posts. Repeatedly doing so is not at all helping your case. It is not "between you and Howsie." When Howsie banned you, he did so on behalf of the Avicus Network. You will receive a reply from support@avicus.net when your appeal is viewed. Do not send in multiple appeals, and do not spam the forums with requests to have your ban appealed- those two actions are going to work against the possible appeal of your ban. Just sit tight and wait. There are currently a very limited number of people actively responding to support emails, and there are likely hundreds of emails. Be patient.
replies.body_tagged: You have made several posts. Repeatedly doing so is not at all helping your case. It is not "between you and Howsie." When Howsie banned you, he did so on behalf of the Avicus Network. You will receive a reply from support@avicus.net when your appeal is viewed. Do not send in multiple appeals, and do not spam the forums with requests to have your ban appealed- those two actions are going to work against the possible appeal of your ban. Just sit tight and wait. There are currently a very limited number of people actively responding to support emails, and there are likely hundreds of emails. Be patient.

replies.body:
The idea is to prevent an uproar from arising in the first place.
He knows that he should appeal via the support email. He has submitted an email in an attempt to do so. There was and still is no need for him to post on the forums about it. He does it once, fine. He didn't know. But it has happened several times. "Begging to be unbanned" is going to accomplish quite the opposite.
replies.body_tagged:
The idea is to prevent an uproar from arising in the first place.
He knows that he should appeal via the support email. He has submitted an email in an attempt to do so. There was and still is no need for him to post on the forums about it. He does it once, fine. He didn't know. But it has happened several times. "Begging to be unbanned" is going to accomplish quite the opposite.

replies.body:
Well with a behaviour like this, it does not seem you deserve your anwser steven.
It is not 55 people howsie has to cover, it is 68.
The director was a rank CREATED by howsie due to the fact that Avigill (max), And howsie Are losing more and more time and cannot stay extremely active, that is why we elected the new managers.
Please do not create flames on a topic you do not fully understand.
If you want your appeal anwsered, respect others first. because at the current time, it seems like you are putting yourself as OUR first priority.

replies.body:
Soul, I know your desperate, but please stay patient, usually it takes quite awhile for an appeal to be answered... espicially now, not everyone is done with school, or partying the last days.... some of them still have finals and all that, and real life is WAY more important than the virtual world...
Soz... just hang in dere :) in the meantime, you could watch avicus on youtube(like legosean10's channel(legosean9) With those youtube videos, it almost feels like you're playing it, with the youtuber's skill.

reply_to.body: You have made several posts. Repeatedly doing so is not at all helping your case. It is not "between you and Howsie." When Howsie banned you, he did so on behalf of the Avicus Network. You will receive a reply from support@avicus.net when your appeal is viewed. Do not send in multiple appeals, and do not spam the forums with requests to have your ban appealed- those two actions are going to work against the possible appeal of your ban. Just sit tight and wait. There are currently a very limited number of people actively responding to support emails, and there are likely hundreds of emails. Be patient.
reply_to.body_tagged: You have made several posts. Repeatedly doing so is not at all helping your case. It is not "between you and Howsie." When Howsie banned you, he did so on behalf of the Avicus Network. You will receive a reply from support@avicus.net when your appeal is viewed. Do not send in multiple appeals, and do not spam the forums with requests to have your ban appealed- those two actions are going to work against the possible appeal of your ban. Just sit tight and wait. There are currently a very limited number of people actively responding to support emails, and there are likely hundreds of emails. Be patient.

replies.body:
Please stop spamming this topic soulreaper2012.

Quite frankly, nobody really cares about this right now, and this is just spamming the forums.

If you really want to get unbanned, you should write another appeal. However, it is very unlikely that you will be unbanned because you were using a hacked client.
